Redford Union Schools Lead Explorer Expedition

On Saturday, October 27th, Lead Explorers from Redford Union Schools were invited to join Central Detroit Christian: Community Development and Flying Classroom on an innovative professional learning experience that focused on urban gardens, farm designs, and aquaponics through the C.D.C. Farm and Fishery Program. Lead explorers participated in a tour of the facility and hands-on experiences. Participants engaged in an engineering design challenge build, called "Mason Jar Aquaponics" and built a "Worm Composting Bin." This real-world experience was taken back to classrooms to use as a teaching tool for ecosystems, sustainable agriculture, plant needs, animal needs and life cycles.
